abstract: Johnson & Johnson reassigned the creative accounts of six brands.  Also, Nokia chose Wieden & Kennedy as worldwide lead agency and Refinery was acquired by G2 Worldwide.
snippet: Johnson & Johnson reassigned the creative accounts of six brands.  Also, Nokia chose Wieden & Kennedy as worldwide lead agency and Refinery was acquired by G2 Worldwide.
lead_paragraph: Johnson & Johnson in New Brunswick, N.J., has reassigned the creative accounts of six brands that had been handled by two agencies owned by the Interpublic Group of Companies. Combined spending was estimated at $135 million.

headline.main: Johnson & Johnson Shifts  Six Creative Assignments
